segment.source: Planning for performance
segment.target: Planning for performance

segment.source: Users expect their apps to remain responsive, to feel natural, and not to drain their battery.
segment.target: Users expect their apps to remain responsive, to feel natural, and not to drain their battery.

segment.source: Planning for performance
segment.target: Planning for performance

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Users expect their apps to remain responsive, to feel natural, and not to drain their battery.
segment.target: Users expect their apps to remain responsive, to feel natural, and not to drain their battery.

segment.source: Technically, performance is a non-functional requirement but treating performance as a feature will help you deliver on your users' expectations.
segment.target: Technically, performance is a non-functional requirement but treating performance as a feature will help you deliver on your users' expectations.

segment.source: Specifying goals, and measuring, are key factors.
segment.target: Specifying goals, and measuring, are key factors.

segment.source: Determine what your performance-critical scenarios are; define what good performance mean.
segment.target: Determine what your performance-critical scenarios are; define what good performance mean.

segment.source: Then measure early and often enough throughout the lifecycle of your project to be confident you'll hit your goals.
segment.target: Then measure early and often enough throughout the lifecycle of your project to be confident you'll hit your goals.

segment.source: Specifying goals
segment.target: Specifying goals

segment.source: The user experience is a basic way to define good performance.
segment.target: The user experience is a basic way to define good performance.

segment.source: An app's startup time can influence a user's perception of its performance.
segment.target: An app's startup time can influence a user's perception of its performance.

segment.source: A user might consider an app launch time of less than one second to be excellent, less than 5 seconds to be good, and greater than 5 seconds to be poor.
segment.target: A user might consider an app launch time of less than one second to be excellent, less than 5 seconds to be good, and greater than 5 seconds to be poor.

segment.source: Other metrics have a less obvious impact on user experience, for example memory.
segment.target: Other metrics have a less obvious impact on user experience, for example memory.

segment.source: The chances of an app being terminated while either suspended or inactive rise with the amount of memory used by the active app.
segment.target: The chances of an app being terminated while either suspended or inactive rise with the amount of memory used by the active app.

segment.source: It's a general rule that high memory usage degrades the experience for all apps on the system, so having a goal on memory consumption is reasonable.
segment.target: It's a general rule that high memory usage degrades the experience for all apps on the system, so having a goal on memory consumption is reasonable.

segment.source: Take into consideration the rough size of your app as perceived by users: small, medium, or large.
segment.target: Take into consideration the rough size of your app as perceived by users: small, medium, or large.

segment.source: Expectations around performance will correlate to this perception.
segment.target: Expectations around performance will correlate to this perception.

segment.source: For example, you might want a small app that doesn't use a lot of media to consume less than 100MB of memory.
segment.target: For example, you might want a small app that doesn't use a lot of media to consume less than 100MB of memory.

segment.source: It's better to set an initial goal, and then revise it later, than not to have a goal at all.
segment.target: It's better to set an initial goal, and then revise it later, than not to have a goal at all.

segment.source: Your app's performance goals should be specific and measurable and they should fall into three categories: how long it takes users, or the app, to complete tasks (time); the rate and continuity with which the app redraws itself in response to user interaction (fluidity); and how well the app conserves system resources, including battery power (efficiency).
segment.target: Your app's performance goals should be specific and measurable and they should fall into three categories: how long it takes users, or the app, to complete tasks (time); the rate and continuity with which the app redraws itself in response to user interaction (fluidity); and how well the app conserves system resources, including battery power (efficiency).

segment.source: Time
segment.target: Time

segment.source: Think of the acceptable ranges of elapsed time (interaction classes) it takes for users to complete their tasks in your app.
segment.target: Think of the acceptable ranges of elapsed time (interaction classes) it takes for users to complete their tasks in your app.

segment.source: For each interaction class assign a label, a perceived user sentiment, and ideal and maximum durations.
segment.target: For each interaction class assign a label, a perceived user sentiment, and ideal and maximum durations.

segment.source: Here are some suggestions.
segment.target: Here are some suggestions.

segment.source: Interaction class label
segment.target: Interaction class label

segment.source: User perception
segment.target: User perception

segment.source: Ideal
segment.target: Ideal

segment.source: Maximum
segment.target: Maximum

segment.source: Examples
segment.target: Examples

segment.source: Fast
segment.target: Fast

segment.source: Minimally noticeable delay
segment.target: Minimally noticeable delay

segment.source: 100 milliseconds
segment.target: 100 milliseconds

segment.source: 200 milliseconds
segment.target: 200 milliseconds

segment.source: Bring up the app bar; press a button (first response)
segment.target: Bring up the app bar; press a button (first response)

segment.source: Typical
segment.target: Typical

segment.source: Quick, but not fast
segment.target: Quick, but not fast

segment.source: 300 milliseconds
segment.target: 300 milliseconds

segment.source: 500 milliseconds
segment.target: 500 milliseconds

segment.source: Resize; semantic zoom
segment.target: Resize; semantic zoom

segment.source: Responsive
segment.target: Responsive

segment.source: Not quick, but feels responsive
segment.target: Not quick, but feels responsive

segment.source: 500 milliseconds
segment.target: 500 milliseconds

segment.source: 1 second
segment.target: 1 second

segment.source: Navigate to a different page; resume the app from a suspended state
segment.target: Navigate to a different page; resume the app from a suspended state

segment.source: Launch
segment.target: Launch

segment.source: Competitive experience
segment.target: Competitive experience

segment.source: 1 second
segment.target: 1 second

segment.source: 3 seconds
segment.target: 3 seconds

segment.source: Launch the app for the first time or after it has been previously terminated
segment.target: Launch the app for the first time or after it has been previously terminated

segment.source: Continuous
segment.target: Continuous

segment.source: No longer feels responsive
segment.target: No longer feels responsive

segment.source: 500 milliseconds
segment.target: 500 milliseconds

segment.source: 5 seconds
segment.target: 5 seconds

segment.source: Download a file from the Internet
segment.target: Download a file from the Internet

segment.source: Captive
segment.target: Captive

segment.source: Long; user could switch away
segment.target: Long; user could switch away

segment.source: 500 milliseconds
segment.target: 500 milliseconds

segment.source: 10 seconds
segment.target: 10 seconds

segment.source: Install multiple apps from the Store
segment.target: Install multiple apps from the Store

segment.source: You can now assign interaction classes to your app's performance scenarios.
segment.target: You can now assign interaction classes to your app's performance scenarios.

segment.source: You can assign the app's point-in-time reference, a portion of the user experience, and an interaction class to each scenario.
segment.target: You can assign the app's point-in-time reference, a portion of the user experience, and an interaction class to each scenario.

segment.source: Here are some suggestions for an example food and dining app.
segment.target: Here are some suggestions for an example food and dining app.

segment.source: Scenario
segment.target: Scenario

segment.source: Time point
segment.target: Time point

segment.source: User experience
segment.target: User experience

segment.source: Interaction class
segment.target: Interaction class

segment.source: Navigate to recipe page
segment.target: Navigate to recipe page

segment.source: First response
segment.target: First response

segment.source: Page transition animation started
segment.target: Page transition animation started

segment.source: Fast (100-200 milliseconds)
segment.target: Fast (100-200 milliseconds)

segment.source: Responsive
segment.target: Responsive

segment.source: Ingredients list loaded; no images
segment.target: Ingredients list loaded; no images

segment.source: Responsive (500 milliseconds - 1 second)
segment.target: Responsive (500 milliseconds - 1 second)

segment.source: Visible complete
segment.target: Visible complete

segment.source: All content loaded; images shown
segment.target: All content loaded; images shown

segment.source: Continuous (500 milliseconds - 5 seconds)
segment.target: Continuous (500 milliseconds - 5 seconds)

segment.source: Search for recipe
segment.target: Search for recipe

segment.source: First response
segment.target: First response

segment.source: Search button clicked
segment.target: Search button clicked

segment.source: Fast (100 - 200 milliseconds)
segment.target: Fast (100 - 200 milliseconds)

segment.source: Visible complete
segment.target: Visible complete

segment.source: List of local recipe titles shown
segment.target: List of local recipe titles shown

segment.source: Typical (300 - 500 milliseconds)
segment.target: Typical (300 - 500 milliseconds)

segment.source: If you're displaying live content then also consider content freshness goals.
segment.target: If you're displaying live content then also consider content freshness goals.

segment.source: Is the goal to refresh content every few seconds?
segment.target: Is the goal to refresh content every few seconds?

segment.source: Or is refreshing content every few minutes, every few hours, or even once a day an acceptable user experience?
segment.target: Or is refreshing content every few minutes, every few hours, or even once a day an acceptable user experience?

segment.source: With your goals specified, you are now better able to test, analyze, and optimize your app.
segment.target: With your goals specified, you are now better able to test, analyze, and optimize your app.

segment.source: Fluidity
segment.target: Fluidity

segment.source: Specific measurable fluidity goals for your app might include:
segment.target: Specific measurable fluidity goals for your app might include:

segment.source: No screen redraw stops-and-starts (glitches).
segment.target: No screen redraw stops-and-starts (glitches).

segment.source: Animations render at 60 frames per second (FPS).
segment.target: Animations render at 60 frames per second (FPS).

segment.source: When a user pans/scrolls, the app presents 3-6 pages of content per second.
segment.target: When a user pans/scrolls, the app presents 3-6 pages of content per second.

segment.source: Efficiency
segment.target: Efficiency

segment.source: Specific measurable efficiency goals for your app might include:
segment.target: Specific measurable efficiency goals for your app might include:

segment.source: For your app's process, CPU percentage is at or below N and memory usage in MB is at or below M at all times.
segment.target: For your app's process, CPU percentage is at or below N and memory usage in MB is at or below M at all times.

segment.source: When the app is inactive, N and M are zero for your app's process.
segment.target: When the app is inactive, N and M are zero for your app's process.

segment.source: Your app can be used actively for X hours on battery power; when your app is inactive, the device retains its charge for Y hours.
segment.target: Your app can be used actively for X hours on battery power; when your app is inactive, the device retains its charge for Y hours.

segment.source: Design your app for performance
segment.target: Design your app for performance

segment.source: You can now use your performance goals to influence your app's design.
segment.target: You can now use your performance goals to influence your app's design.

segment.source: Using the example food and dining app, after the user navigates to the recipe page, you might choose to update items incrementally so that the recipe's name is rendered first, displaying the ingredients is deferred, and displaying images is deferred further.
segment.target: Using the example food and dining app, after the user navigates to the recipe page, you might choose to update items incrementally so that the recipe's name is rendered first, displaying the ingredients is deferred, and displaying images is deferred further.

segment.source: This maintains responsiveness and a fluid UI while panning/scrolling, with the full fidelity rendering taking place after the interaction slows to a pace that allow the UI thread to catch up.
segment.target: This maintains responsiveness and a fluid UI while panning/scrolling, with the full fidelity rendering taking place after the interaction slows to a pace that allow the UI thread to catch up.

segment.source: Here are some other aspects to consider.
segment.target: Here are some other aspects to consider.

segment.source: UI
segment.target: UI

segment.source: Maximize parse and load time and memory efficiency for each page of your app's UI (especially the initial page) by optimizing your XAML markup.
segment.target: Maximize parse and load time and memory efficiency for each page of your app's UI (especially the initial page) by optimizing your XAML markup.

segment.source: In a nutshell, defer loading UI and code until it's needed.
segment.target: In a nutshell, defer loading UI and code until it's needed.

segment.source: For ListView and GridView, make all the items the same size and use as many ListView and GridView optimization techniques as you can.
segment.target: For ListView and GridView, make all the items the same size and use as many ListView and GridView optimization techniques as you can.

segment.source: Declare UI in the form of markup, which the framework can load and re-use in chunks, rather than constructing it imperatively in code.
segment.target: Declare UI in the form of markup, which the framework can load and re-use in chunks, rather than constructing it imperatively in code.

segment.source: Collapse UI elements until the user needs them.
segment.target: Collapse UI elements until the user needs them.

segment.source: See the Visibility property.
segment.target: See the Visibility property.

segment.source: Prefer theme transitions and animations to storyboarded animations.
segment.target: Prefer theme transitions and animations to storyboarded animations.

segment.source: For more info, see Animations overview.
segment.target: For more info, see Animations overview.

segment.source: Remember that storyboarded animations require constant updates to the screen, and keep the CPU and graphics pipeline active.
segment.target: Remember that storyboarded animations require constant updates to the screen, and keep the CPU and graphics pipeline active.

segment.source: To preserve the battery, don't have animations running if the user is not interacting with the app.
segment.target: To preserve the battery, don't have animations running if the user is not interacting with the app.

segment.source: Images you load should be loaded at a size that is appropriate for the view in which you are presenting it, using the GetThumbnailAsync method.
segment.target: Images you load should be loaded at a size that is appropriate for the view in which you are presenting it, using the GetThumbnailAsync method.

segment.source: CPU, memory, and power
segment.target: CPU, memory, and power

segment.source: Schedule lower-priority work to run on lower-priority threads and/or cores.
segment.target: Schedule lower-priority work to run on lower-priority threads and/or cores.

segment.source: See Asynchronous programming, the Dispatcher property, and the CoreDispatcher class.
segment.target: See Asynchronous programming, the Dispatcher property, and the CoreDispatcher class.

segment.source: Minimize your app's memory footprint by releasing expensive resources (such as media) on suspend.
segment.target: Minimize your app's memory footprint by releasing expensive resources (such as media) on suspend.

segment.source: Minimize your code's working set.
segment.target: Minimize your code's working set.

segment.source: Avoid memory leaks by unregistering event handlers and dereferencing UI elements whenever possible.
segment.target: Avoid memory leaks by unregistering event handlers and dereferencing UI elements whenever possible.

segment.source: For the sake of the battery, be conservative with how often you poll for data, query a sensor, or schedule work on the CPU when it is idle.
segment.target: For the sake of the battery, be conservative with how often you poll for data, query a sensor, or schedule work on the CPU when it is idle.

segment.source: Data access
segment.target: Data access

segment.source: If possible, prefetch content.
segment.target: If possible, prefetch content.

segment.source: For automatic prefetching, see the ContentPrefetcher class.
segment.target: For automatic prefetching, see the ContentPrefetcher class.

segment.source: For manual prefetching, see the Windows.ApplicationModel.Background namespace and the MaintenanceTrigger class.
segment.target: For manual prefetching, see the Windows.ApplicationModel.Background namespace and the MaintenanceTrigger class.

segment.source: If possible, cache content that's expensive to access.
segment.target: If possible, cache content that's expensive to access.

segment.source: See the LocalFolder and LocalSettings properties.
segment.target: See the LocalFolder and LocalSettings properties.

segment.source: For cache misses, show a placeholder UI as quickly as possible that indicates that the app is still loading content.
segment.target: For cache misses, show a placeholder UI as quickly as possible that indicates that the app is still loading content.

segment.source: Transition from placeholder to live content in a way that is not jarring to the user.
segment.target: Transition from placeholder to live content in a way that is not jarring to the user.

segment.source: For example, don't change the position of content under the user's finger or mouse pointer as the app loads live content.
segment.target: For example, don't change the position of content under the user's finger or mouse pointer as the app loads live content.

segment.source: App launch and resume
segment.target: App launch and resume

segment.source: Defer the app's splash screen, and don't extend the app's splash screen unless necessary.
segment.target: Defer the app's splash screen, and don't extend the app's splash screen unless necessary.

segment.source: For details, see Creating a fast and fluid app launch experience and Display a splash screen for more time.
segment.target: For details, see Creating a fast and fluid app launch experience and Display a splash screen for more time.

segment.source: Disable animations that occur immediately after the splash screen is dismissed, as these will only lead to a perception of delay in app launch time.
segment.target: Disable animations that occur immediately after the splash screen is dismissed, as these will only lead to a perception of delay in app launch time.

segment.source: Adaptive UI, and orientation
segment.target: Adaptive UI, and orientation

segment.source: Use the VisualStateManager class.
segment.target: Use the VisualStateManager class.

segment.source: Complete only required work immediately, deferring intensive app work until later—your app has between 200 and 800 milliseconds to complete work before the user sees your app's UI in a cropped state.
segment.target: Complete only required work immediately, deferring intensive app work until later—your app has between 200 and 800 milliseconds to complete work before the user sees your app's UI in a cropped state.

segment.source: With your performance-related designs in place, you can start coding your app.
segment.target: With your performance-related designs in place, you can start coding your app.

segment.source: Instrument for performance
segment.target: Instrument for performance

segment.source: As you code, add code that logs messages and events at certain points while your app runs.
segment.target: As you code, add code that logs messages and events at certain points while your app runs.

segment.source: Later, when you're testing your app, you can use profiling tools such as Windows Performance Recorder and Windows Performance Analyzer (both are included in the Windows Performance Toolkit) to create and view a report about your app's performance.
segment.target: Later, when you're testing your app, you can use profiling tools such as Windows Performance Recorder and Windows Performance Analyzer (both are included in the Windows Performance Toolkit) to create and view a report about your app's performance.

segment.source: In this report, you can look for these messages and events to help you more easily analyze the report's results.
segment.target: In this report, you can look for these messages and events to help you more easily analyze the report's results.

segment.source: The Universal Windows Platform (UWP) provides logging APIs, backed by Event Tracing for Windows (ETW), that together offer a rich event logging and tracing solution.
segment.target: The Universal Windows Platform (UWP) provides logging APIs, backed by Event Tracing for Windows (ETW), that together offer a rich event logging and tracing solution.

segment.source: The APIs, which are part of the Windows.Foundation.Diagnostics namespace, include the FileLoggingSession, LoggingActivity, LoggingChannel, and LoggingSession classes.
segment.target: The APIs, which are part of the Windows.Foundation.Diagnostics namespace, include the FileLoggingSession, LoggingActivity, LoggingChannel, and LoggingSession classes.

segment.source: To log a message in the report at a specific point while the app is running, create a LoggingChannel object, and then call the object's LogMessage method, like this.
segment.target: To log a message in the report at a specific point while the app is running, create a LoggingChannel object, and then call the object's LogMessage method, like this.

segment.source: To log start and stop events in the report over a period of time while the app is running, create a LoggingActivity object, and then call the object's LoggingActivity constructor, like this.
segment.target: To log start and stop events in the report over a period of time while the app is running, create a LoggingActivity object, and then call the object's LoggingActivity constructor, like this.

segment.source: Also see the Logging sample.
segment.target: Also see the Logging sample.

segment.source: With your app instrumented, you can test and measure your app's performance.
segment.target: With your app instrumented, you can test and measure your app's performance.

segment.source: Test and measure against performance goals
segment.target: Test and measure against performance goals

segment.source: Part of your performance plan is to define the points during development where you'll measure performance.
segment.target: Part of your performance plan is to define the points during development where you'll measure performance.

segment.source: This serves different purposes depending on whether you're measuring during prototyping, development, or deployment.
segment.target: This serves different purposes depending on whether you're measuring during prototyping, development, or deployment.

segment.source: Measuring performance during the early stages of prototyping can be tremendously valuable, so we recommend that you do so as soon as you have code that does meaningful work.
segment.target: Measuring performance during the early stages of prototyping can be tremendously valuable, so we recommend that you do so as soon as you have code that does meaningful work.

segment.source: Early measurements give you a good idea of where the important costs are in your app, and inform design decisions.
segment.target: Early measurements give you a good idea of where the important costs are in your app, and inform design decisions.

segment.source: This results in high performing and scaling apps.
segment.target: This results in high performing and scaling apps.

segment.source: It's generally costlier to change designs later than earlier.
segment.target: It's generally costlier to change designs later than earlier.

segment.source: Measuring performance late in the product cycle can result in last-minute hacks and poor performance.
segment.target: Measuring performance late in the product cycle can result in last-minute hacks and poor performance.

segment.source: Use these techniques and tools to test how your app stacks up against your original performance goals.
segment.target: Use these techniques and tools to test how your app stacks up against your original performance goals.

segment.source: Test against a wide variety of hardware configurations including all-in-one and desktop PCs, laptops, ultrabooks, and tablets and other mobile devices.
segment.target: Test against a wide variety of hardware configurations including all-in-one and desktop PCs, laptops, ultrabooks, and tablets and other mobile devices.

segment.source: Test against a wide variety of screen sizes.
segment.target: Test against a wide variety of screen sizes.

segment.source: While wider screen sizes can show much more content, bringing in all of that extra content can negatively impact performance.
segment.target: While wider screen sizes can show much more content, bringing in all of that extra content can negatively impact performance.

segment.source: Eliminate as many testing variables as you can.
segment.target: Eliminate as many testing variables as you can.

segment.source: Turn off background apps on the testing device.
segment.target: Turn off background apps on the testing device.

segment.source: To do this, in Windows, select Settings from the Start menu Personalization Lock screen.
segment.target: To do this, in Windows, select Settings from the Start menu Personalization Lock screen.

segment.source: Select each active app and select None.
segment.target: Select each active app and select None.

segment.source: Compile your app to native code by building it in release configuration before deploying it to the testing device.
segment.target: Compile your app to native code by building it in release configuration before deploying it to the testing device.

segment.source: To ensure that automatic maintenance does not affect the performance of the testing device, trigger it manually and wait for it to complete.
segment.target: To ensure that automatic maintenance does not affect the performance of the testing device, trigger it manually and wait for it to complete.

segment.source: In Windows, in the Start menu search for Security and Maintenance.
segment.target: In Windows, in the Start menu search for Security and Maintenance.

segment.source: In the Maintenance area, under Automatic Maintenance, select Start maintenance and wait for the status to change from Maintenance in progress.
segment.target: In the Maintenance area, under Automatic Maintenance, select Start maintenance and wait for the status to change from Maintenance in progress.

segment.source: Run the app multiple times to help eliminate random testing variables and help ensure consistent measurements.
segment.target: Run the app multiple times to help eliminate random testing variables and help ensure consistent measurements.

segment.source: Test for reduced power availability.
segment.target: Test for reduced power availability.

segment.source: Your users' device might have significantly less power than your development machine.
segment.target: Your users' device might have significantly less power than your development machine.

segment.source: Windows was designed with low-power devices, such as mobile devices, in mind.
segment.target: Windows was designed with low-power devices, such as mobile devices, in mind.

segment.source: Apps that run on the platform should ensure they perform well on these devices.
segment.target: Apps that run on the platform should ensure they perform well on these devices.

segment.source: As a heuristic, expect that a low power device runs at about a quarter the speed of a desktop computer, and set your goals accordingly.
segment.target: As a heuristic, expect that a low power device runs at about a quarter the speed of a desktop computer, and set your goals accordingly.

segment.source: Use a combination of tools like Microsoft Visual Studio and Windows Performance Analyzer to measure app performance.
segment.target: Use a combination of tools like Microsoft Visual Studio and Windows Performance Analyzer to measure app performance.

segment.source: Visual Studio is designed to provide app-focused analysis, such as source code linking.
segment.target: Visual Studio is designed to provide app-focused analysis, such as source code linking.

segment.source: Windows Performance Analyzer is designed to provide system-focused analysis, such as providing system info, info about touch manipulation events, and info about disk input/output (I/O) and graphics processing unit (GPU) cost.
segment.target: Windows Performance Analyzer is designed to provide system-focused analysis, such as providing system info, info about touch manipulation events, and info about disk input/output (I/O) and graphics processing unit (GPU) cost.

segment.source: Both tools provide trace capture and export, and can reopen shared and post-mortem traces.
segment.target: Both tools provide trace capture and export, and can reopen shared and post-mortem traces.

segment.source: Before you submit your app to the Store for certification, be sure to incorporate into your test plans the performance-related test cases as described in the "Performance tests" section of Windows App Certification Kit tests and in the "Performance and stability" section of Windows Store app test cases.
segment.target: Before you submit your app to the Store for certification, be sure to incorporate into your test plans the performance-related test cases as described in the "Performance tests" section of Windows App Certification Kit tests and in the "Performance and stability" section of Windows Store app test cases.

segment.source: For more info, see these resources and profiling tools.
segment.target: For more info, see these resources and profiling tools.

segment.source: Windows Performance Analyzer
segment.target: Windows Performance Analyzer

segment.source: Windows Performance Toolkit
segment.target: Windows Performance Toolkit

segment.source: Analyze performance using Visual Studio diagnostic tools
segment.target: Analyze performance using Visual Studio diagnostic tools

segment.source: The //build/ session XAML Performance
segment.target: The //build/ session XAML Performance

segment.source: The //build/ session New XAML Tools in Visual Studio 2015
segment.target: The //build/ session New XAML Tools in Visual Studio 2015

segment.source: Respond to the performance test results
segment.target: Respond to the performance test results

segment.source: After you analyze your performance test results, determine if any changes are needed, for example:
segment.target: After you analyze your performance test results, determine if any changes are needed, for example:

segment.source: Should you change any of your app design decisions, or optimize your code?
segment.target: Should you change any of your app design decisions, or optimize your code?

segment.source: Should you add, remove, or change any of the instrumentation in the code?
segment.target: Should you add, remove, or change any of the instrumentation in the code?

segment.source: Should you revise any of your performance goals?
segment.target: Should you revise any of your performance goals?

segment.source: If any changes are needed, make them and then go back to instrumenting or testing and repeat.
segment.target: If any changes are needed, make them and then go back to instrumenting or testing and repeat.

segment.source: Optimizing
segment.target: Optimizing

segment.source: Optimize only the performance-critical code paths in your app: those where most time is spent.
segment.target: Optimize only the performance-critical code paths in your app: those where most time is spent.

segment.source: Profiling will tell you which.
segment.target: Profiling will tell you which.

segment.source: Often, there is a trade-off between creating software that follows good design practices and writing code that performs at the highest optimization.
segment.target: Often, there is a trade-off between creating software that follows good design practices and writing code that performs at the highest optimization.

segment.source: It is generally better to prioritize developer productivity and good software design in areas where performance is not a concern.
segment.target: It is generally better to prioritize developer productivity and good software design in areas where performance is not a concern.
